result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Fuchs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

miscConds.notes: Psychological evaluation and treatment as recommended.
Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without agent's written permission. May not use internet without agent's approval.
Cognitive Thinking or Thinking for Change class. Sex Offender treatment as deemed appropriate.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

AMENDED CASH BOND
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
- If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $30,000 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant may attend child's birth at Meriter Hospital.  
- Defendant shall not have any contact with female juveniles unless supervised by a responsible adult.
- Defendant shall only be at his home, in his yard, or at his place of employment,
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall have GPS monitoring.
- Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- No Internet access from the Defnedant's home.
- Defendant shall have no internet access whatsoever. 
- Defendant shall not access the internet or any social media websites or applications.
- Defendant is permitted to travel to pre-arranged medical, dental and legal appointments.  Defendant is permitted to travel for emergency situations.
